resources.string: Hidden Palace Zone\'s music was supposed to be used for a cutscene.
A sequel to Marble Madness was created, but never released.
Namco made a Pole Position game where Pac-Man is driving the car.
Sega made a Space Harrier game where you play as Opa-Opa.
Pokemon Pinball includes music from the Japanese and English show.
There are many bootleg NES games that call themselves sequels to the original three Super Mario Bros. games.\nThese numbered sequels go up to 17.
